class pynuts.view.ModelView(keys=None, data=None)[source]¶

This class represents the view of a SQLAlchemy model class.

It grants CRUD operations and offers the view corresponding.

Parameters:
  • keys (String, Tuple) – Your model primary keys
  • data (Dict) – Your model data

SQLAlchemy model

list_column = None¶

The column which represents your class

view_columns = None¶

The columns displayed in the view list

table_columns = None¶

The columns displayed in the table

edit_columns = None¶

The columns you can edit

create_columns = None¶

The column you can set when creating an instance

primary_keys[source]¶

Primary keys/value dict.

name[source]¶

Common name.

form = None¶

WTForms view form. Declare it in your view like this:

>>> MyView(ModelView):
...     class Form(Form):
...         id = IntegerField(u'Id', validators=[Required()])
...         name = TextField(u'Last name', validators=[Required()])

create(template=None, redirect=None, values=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Define the create method. Also check the values in the form: If the values are OK : commit the form with its data; Else : Display the form with errors.

Parameters:
  • template (String) – The template you want to render
  • redirect (String) – The URL where you want to redirect after the function
  • values (Dict) – The values of the object you want to create
edit(template=None, redirect=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Parameters:

  • redirect (String) – The URL where you want to redirect after the function

This class represents a document object.

Jinja Environment

Branch name of the document.

Branch name of the document archives.

Actual git version of the document.

Yield the parent documents.

archive_history()¶

Yield the parent documents stored as archives.

Serve static files for documents.

classmethod generate_HTML(part='index.rst.jinja2', resource_type='url', **kwargs)[source]¶

Generate the HTML samples of the document.

The output is a dict corresponding to the different HTML samples as generated by Docutils.

See also

Docutils writer publish parts

Parameters:
  • part – part of the document to render.
  • resource_type – external resource type: ‘url’ or ‘base64’.
classmethod generate_PDF(**kwargs)[source]¶

Generate PDF from the document.

classmethod download_PDF(filename=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a HTTP response with PDF document as file in attachment.

Parameters:filename (String) – set the filname attachment.
classmethod archive(**kwargs)¶

Archive the current version of the document.

classmethod create(**kwargs)[source]¶

Create the ReST document.

Return True if the document has been created, False if the document id was already used.

classmethod edit(template, part='index.html.jinja2', redirect_url=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return the template where you can edit the ReST document.

Parameters:
  • template – your application template.
  • redirect_url – the route you want to go after saving.

Return True if the document has been edited, False if the document id was already used.

Environment¶

Jinja2 environment for pynuts.

class pynuts.environment.ShowOnMatch(environment)[source]¶

This extension introduces a new tag showonmatch, allowing conditional output of a its body according to a css selector.

This will output an ul with lis if mylist is not empty, or no result otherwise:

{% showonmatch 'ul li' %}
  <ul>
  {% for a in mylist %}
    <li>{{a}}</li>
  {% endfor %}
  </ul>
  {% else %}
    <p>No result</p>
{% endshowonmatch %}
pynuts.environment.create_environment()¶

Create a new Jinja2 environment with Pynuts helpers.
